Job Description:
ABOUT BITFOCUS, INC.

Founded in 2003, Bitfocus, Inc. is changing the way communities nationwide integrate software, systems, data, and policy to innovate and strengthen the nation's social safety net. We develop software and administer data systems that affect and change lives, connecting our most vulnerable populations to the most effective resources available in their communities. Our products empower organizations and communities to better leverage their resources, helping them to become data-driven in their efforts in all areas of health, human, and social services.

Our diverse and inclusive culture has played a key role in our success at Bitfocus. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or disability.

About our Data Services Team:

Our Data Services team's mission is to promote a data driven decision-making culture to solve homelessness. We do this by combining a team of experts in data modeling, analytics, and integration with social services experience. From one-time data migrations into Clarity Human Services, to real-time dashboarding, the Data Services team plays an integral role is supporting communities to make data driven decisions.

Success/Impact Statement:

The Data Integration Analyst will obtain, analyze, transform and load data from client file extracts into Clarity Human Services. S/he will work primarily with our client's staff as well as with internal Bitfocus staff. A passion for data, detail, and concern for data integrity is key to a candidate's success.

As a Data Services Analyst, you will:
Initiate, analyze, design, develop, test and implement client data imports using a mixture of SQL, spreadsheets, and ETL tools.
Consult with customers, enabling them to understand data requirements to integrate data files with Clarity Human Services.
Cleanse, map and transform customer data to Clarity Human Services schema and data standards.
Provide feedback to customers and work with them to resolve any discrepancies.
Resolve any data related issues found post-production, including obtaining clarification from customers, correct data issues and/or develop alternative solutions.
Perform value analyses as required to support integrations initiatives.
Develop tools and/or methods to facilitate the above functions.
Act as a subject matter expert and liaison with other areas within Clarity Human Services on data integration topics.
Complete ad-hoc projects as assigned.
You will love this position if:
You want to make an impact. You thrive on helping others and want your work to make a difference.
You love data and use it to make decisions.
You want to be part of a world class, dedicated, supportive team.
Required experience that drives success in this role:
1 3 years' experience in an IT or data integration environment.
Strong SQL skills, including the ability to write queries and stored procedures.
Solid understanding of data systems, including data relationships and data modeling with the ability to learn and understand various data environments.
Effective written and oral communications skills in English.
Ability to conduct meetings over the telephone and web.
Sound planning and organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple concurrent projects and priorities in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
Work independently and with others; self-directed and results-oriented.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Willingness to learn new technologies to best solve data-related issues.
What makes you stand out:
Experience working in a completely remote company.
A college degree (a major in information systems, computer science, mathematics, finance, accounting, statistics or related field is preferred).
MariaDB/ MySQL experience preferred.
PDI or another ETL software experience preferred.
Data Analytics tools such as Looker or Tableau preferred
Strong preference for experience in social services and/or HMIS experience.
How we'll support you:
Work in a fully remote/virtual environment
A unique, friendly and caring culture! Hear more from our employees on Glassdoor.
Medical, dental, vision insurance
401K Retirement Plan
Paid parental leave
Paid time off
Paid volunteer time off
Bitfocus primarily uses Apple computers; all new employees receive either an iMac or MacBook Pro to use in their role at Bitfocus
Opportunities for professional growth and development

JOB SUMMARYTory Burch is looking for a talented, KPI and customer-obsessed Data Analyst to help build and execute strategies driving the companys continued growth in Retail and eCommerce. This role offers the unique opportunity to drive large scale, highly visible projects across different teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Support CRM campaigns by analyzing audiences and creating audience segments
Create clienteling lists based on insights and list performance
Support global/regional businesses by conducting customer analysis and analyzing promotions
Create customer KPI reports to increase understanding of the business
Manage Customer Insights Dashboards, providing summary of key insights for stakeholders on monthly and quarterly basis
Execute audience segments for CRM, Email, Clienteling, and Digital Marketing campaigns using Data Lake or using in-house BI tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau), as well as other web-based segmentation tools
Analyze performance of CRM, Email, or Clienteling campaigns and tests
Support CRM/IT in the reconciliation of data from a variety of sources; devise and/or improve processes to monitor data and ensure its accuracy and integrity
Develop test plans, manage and execute user acceptance testing to ensure accuracy of customer attributes across internal systems

QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years of experience in data and analytics working with large and complicated data; eCommerce and Retail experience preferred
Proficient knowledge of data base and campaign management
Preferred degree with a specialization in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative field or equivalent
Mastery of SQL, Python, and other scripting/automation techniques
Experience with Hadoop, specifically Cloudera, is required
Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software is required
Experience with reporting tools such as Microstrategy or other BI tools is preferred
Knowledge of email, direct mail and database marketing concepts (such as segmentation) is required
Knowledge of customer data management such as customer data consolidation, cleansing, and testing is preferred
Proficient at all Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Attention to detail, thorough and quality oriented

DESIRED ATTRIBUTES
Understands marketing processes involved in campaign management, marketing analytics and reporting
Ability to manage and synthesize large sets of complex data and present actionable insights in a clear, concise manner
Strong understanding of KPIs/metrics/attributes related to direct-to-consumer data
Adaptable - with ability to manage multiple projects and priorities concurrently
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently, via written and oral formats, to all levels of the organization
Committed to working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment

Job Summary

Under the direction of the Manager of STI, acts as an analytical and technical resource to the Commercial Sales Department, and other Tufts HP departments on an as needed basis. This advanced level support includes the design and development of report applications and ad-hoc complex reporting and analyses related to employer group cost and utilization and Sales Management (results, trends, opportunities, forecasting, etc.). Under the direction of the Manager of STI, the Technical Analyst will support ongoing development, maintenance and documentation of development environments and reports, working with EASE and IS to analyze existing systems and implement system changes and upgrades, refine and develop new and existing technical hardware and software tools and applications in order to meet the needs of the department and to ensure timely, cost effective, quality reporting.

Job Description
Provide advanced level analytical and technical support to the Commercial Sales, and other Tufts HP departments, as needed, including the following:
Design and development of new reporting applications, reports and analyses for both Sales Management and Employer Group reports and analyses (results, trends, opportunities, forecasting, etc.) using advanced software tools including Alteryx, Tableau and Cognos applications in order to further the overall performance and goals of the department.
Ensure that all reports and analyses are complete, accurate, and produced within the required deadlines. Interact with end users and customers to clarify issues and questions related to the analysis and/or project(s) and validate the results of the reports being produced
Support the ongoing development, maintenance and documentation of Alteryx collections and workflows, Tableau Projects and workbooks, and Cognos reporting
Work with the Manager of STI, Project Manager III, EASE and IS to review, document and implement, when needed, system changes and upgrades and the impact to the development environments end resulting reports.
Assist in supporting and “trouble-shooting” issues and problems as they arrive
Continue to assess, refine and develop new and existing efficiencies to support workflow and reporting applications in order to meet the needs of the department and to ensure timely, cost effective, quality reporting.
May be asked to support ad-hoc projects and assist STI and other ad-hoc reports as needed
Requirements

EDUCATION: (Minimum educations & certifications required)

Master’s degree preferred in Business, Health Care Management or Computer Science, or related field is required.

EXPERIENCE: (Years of experience)

Minimum of 3 years of analytical and technical applications’ development work experience.

Requires proficiency in related technical tools such as Structured Query Language (SQL), Cognos, Alteryx and Tableau. HMO and/or Health Care industry experience preferred.

SKILL REQUIREMENTS: (Include interpersonal skills)

Must be able to work well in a team environment, as well as the ability to work independently to completed deliverables. Communication and leadership skills. Proven ability to apply programming and software from existing programs and projects.

Create new technical standards and solutions in the design, documentation and implementation of analyses and reporting applications and projects. Must be able to understand and articulate the complexities in the development environment as they relate to managed care. Must be well organized and possess strong interpersonal skills while working in a team environment

WORKING CONDITIONS AND ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS (include special requirements, e.g., lifting, travel,

overtime)

Fast paced office environment handling multiple demands and priorities and exercising appropriate judgment as necessary. This position requires that the individual be highly organized while being readily adaptable to changes in technical tools and analytical methods as well as rapid changes in priorities. Must be able to work independently as well as cooperatively as a team member to promote a mutually supportive team environment.

Must be able to work in a remote setting, if needed, while continuing to have appropriate communication skills with team members. Minimal travel maybe required.

Occasional overtime and weekend hours to complete deliverables maybe required as needed.

Position:
Big Data Business Analyst
Job Description:


We're hiring a Big Data Business Analyst!

Arrow Digital is a growing and fast-paced division of Arrow Electronics, a leading electronics components distributor and provider of enterprise computing solutions. The decision support team within Arrow Digital is seeking a flexible and talented business analyst at its headquarters in Denver, CO. The analyst will work with executives and business users to define technical solutions to business problems for the eCommerce business units within Arrow Digital, independently develop prototype solutions, and collaborate with the development team to implement those solutions in production.

Big Data requires a business analyst/project management role in order for the team to operate more like a traditional development team. This person would manage the group's ticket boards, scope new projects, trouble shoot and assign issues to the appropriate developer, and handle most ad hoc requests.

What You'll Be Doing:

-Work with business leaders across eCommerce to understand decision support needs

-Independently plan, propose and implement one-off and proof of concept decision support systems

-Collaborate with the Big Data development teams to plan and move prototypes to more advanced stages, up to and including production

-Deliver results to business users via project plans, progress reports, formal reports, and presentations

-Prepare and maintain documentation for all projects through tickets and technical manuals

-Participate in code and workflow maintenance as needed

What We're Looking For:

-Passionate about the value of bringing technical solutions to bear on complicated business decisions and processes

-Able to bring order to chaos through thought, planning, and organization

-Possess a mix of both technical skills and business knowledge

-Intuitive understanding of the interface between technology and business

-Strong technical contributor, quantitative thinker, and intellectually fearless

-Able to operate across multiple business contexts simultaneously

-Demonstrated ability to learn while doing and at home operating under conditions of uncertainty with minimal supervision

-Experienced and talented communicator

Education Requirements:

-MS in a quantitative field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience

-At least 3 semesters of advanced or applied mathematics, preferably in statistics

-Project management or agile methodology coursework

Required Experience:

-3 y experience independently identifying, developing and implementing technical solutions for business problems

-3 y experience in a Project Management, Product Owner, scrum master, or consulting role

-Experience using statistics to analyze both traditional and ecommerce business metrics

Required Skills:

-Advanced SQL development skills

-Advanced skills with at least a BI tool like Tableau

-Capable user of common statistical analysis methods

-Proficient with Google Analytics, microstrategy, crystal reports or another BI suite

-Proficient with VCS and JIRA

-Proficient with at least one ERP

-Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, and Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides

-Proficient with Linux, OS X, and Windows

-Comfortable working with a command line interface

Bonus points for:

-Experience with hadoop workflow management tools like Oozie

Whats In It For You

At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. Thats why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
401k, With Matching Contributions
Generous Paid Time Off
Health Savings Account (HSA)/Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) Options
Growth Opportunities
Short-Term/Long-Term Disability Insurance

24/7/365 On-site Gym and Lockers, Free for Use to All Employees!
Bike Racks
And more!

Job Description

One of our top LA clients is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team, this is a newly created position! They are one of the largest hedge funds on the West Coast and are managing over $25B in assets. Technical Connections has staffed over half of their technology team in the past 15 years. The Data Management team is responsible for governance over trading related data including security attributes, position-level characteristics, and risk metrics.

Who are you?
You have at least two years of experience working for a hedge fund, fixed-income asset manager, investment bank, or financial technology company focused on capital markets.
You have a passion for all things data, you enjoy working closely with the trading floor, trading desk and compliance teams. You will also interface with Tech, portfolio management, fund accounting and regulatory reporting.
You are willing to take the time to learn how security attributes impact the departments listed above.
You have a Bachelor’s degree (or higher) from an accredited school, preferably a top school.
Financial products are something you are passionate about including bonds, structured products, loans, CDS, equities, options, etc.
Proficiency with Excel, or BI Tools, helpful to have experience with Bloomberg and SQL.
What’s in it for you?
An excellent leadership team who fosters growth, low turnover. Very stable company, have been in business for 25 years, free lunch, awesome Century City location, 100% paid medical benefits, competitive salary and bonus.

Rethink what’s possible with SwitchThink! SwitchThink Solutions is an IT Services CUSO from Desert Financial.

As a collaborative partner for innovation, SwitchThink Solutions offers technology solutions that help credit unions achieve their transformational goals. Our knowledgeable development, infrastructure, and IT operations experts work hand-in-hand with our clients to maximize the benefits of their technology and speed their results.

Who you are:

A hardworking analyst with a flair for consulting with and supporting clients with their enterprise reporting, data integration, and data analytic needs, including the development of dashboards. You are motivated by the opportunity to work closely with clients to analyze and interpret data in support of identifying market and business trends, conduct root cause analyses of business problems and provide strategic suggestions for improvement.

A typical week might include the following:

Consulting with clients to understand their unique business problems, then with the utilization data recommending solutions that will ultimately assist in solving the business problem by defining data/reporting requirements and goals.

Designing and developing solutions using Power BI and Jaspersoft, that enable clients to make decisions based on data utilizing dashboards and self-service reports

Providing support with troubleshooting and resolving reporting, dashboard related issues

Performing other job-related duties as assigned.

This role might be right for you if you have:

High School Diploma or Equivalent

5+ years experience in business intelligence role; collecting requirements and report development

Experience with SQL or PostgreSQL

Bonus Points:

A Bachelor's Degree in computer science, math or related field

Experience working with Talend or similar ETL tools

Experience working in a DB2 environment

Financial Services Industry quantitative/ analysis/ reporting

About Us

We are considered leaders in the local credit union space, and we are growing like crazy. We’ve got a culture focused on smarts, kindness, continuous learning...and our people love it. A full 93% of our employees would recommend us to their friends. Come find out why! Learn more at jobs.desertfinancial.com.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Develop automated business review reports from the ground up, providing the cross-functional teams with the necessary tools to make timely business decisions, including key metrics and important; retail analytics; Work to develop omni-channel marketing campaigns targeted to purposefully steer customer behavior; Interpret, analysis of collected data using different tools, statistical techniques such as MS Excel and data management systems to provide accurate & reliable reports to the company; access data from internal databases and build and maintain data systems; develop a healthy data collection systems & sound strategies for getting quality data from different sources to use it to right place efficiently; prepare presentations, conducting research and maintaining quality of database systems; assist database administrators in database administration, design, security also timely maintenance of data base as well; prepare various statistical reports on operational performance on monthly, quarterly and annual basis; Prepare drafts and develops standards for different reports on data management systems; monitors, train and giving direction on the work of lower-level staff. Relocation/telecommuting may be required plus travel to various unanticipated client locations within the United States for short and long term assignments.

Voleon is a technology company that applies state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to real-world problems in finance. For more than a decade, we have led our industry and worked at the frontier of applying machine learning to investment management. We have become a multibillion dollar asset manager, and we have ambitious goals for the future.

Your colleagues will include internationally recognized experts in machine learning research as well as highly experienced technology and finance professionals. The people who shape our company come from other backgrounds, too, including concert music performance, humanitarian aid, opera singing, sports writing, and BMX racing. You will be part of a team that loves to succeed together.

In addition to our enriching and collegial working environment, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, technology talks by our experts, a modern office, daily catered lunches, and more.

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for owning and simplifying the flow of data used by production trading algorithms at Voleon. Your work will focus on curating datasets and building processes and tools to standardize and simplify this curation. This role is a means to make a difference: as a machine learning company, data is essential to our business.
Responsibilities
Perform manual steps and develop automated processes to ensure the completeness and integrity of massive amounts of mission critical financial data pertaining to stocks, bonds, futures, commodities, and more
Partner with Members of Research Staff to curate new and existing datasets
Help drive continuous improvements to data quality procedures and a consistent approach to how data quality is measured, monitored and reported
Design systematic and automated processes and tools that allow the team to scale and rapidly onboard new datasets
Work global market hours from our Berkeley office for a portion of every year on a rotational basis
Requirements
Coursework or other relevant training in data analytics, programming, or computing systems
Proven problem-solving and analytical abilities including pattern detection, root cause analysis, and issue resolution
An interest in programming and data analysis / data science
Bachelor’s degree with a strong academic record
Authorization to work in the United States
Preferred Qualifications
Relevant experience in data operations, with proven process improvement skills
An understanding of the software development process and exposure to hands-on coding in a professional environment
Experience in exploratory data analysis and applied statistics
Experience with Python
Experience with SQL and working with a relational database system
Experience with Linux
While financial industry experience is a plus, we are open-minded in our search for critical thinkers who are passionate about technology and data

Job Description

Join the Cerner ITWorks team onsite at Tiger Institute-Columbia working in partnership on the continuous improvement of healthcare for the Columbia, MO area.

As a Data Analyst at the Tiger Institute you will have the primary responsibility to analyze, prepare, and process data sets to be consumed for direct insights, statistical modeling or other analytical exploration utilizing the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and Business Intelligence tools. You will be aligned with the Information Management and Population Health Client Services team to leverage its business intelligence resources to support population health and analytics initiatives at MU Health Care.

You will represent a unique opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data and complete analyses to solve business problems. This includes gathering business requirements from end users, developing data sets and performing pertinent analyses.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Analytics, or related field; or equivalent relevant work experience
Course work or work experience in SQL programming and/or report building
At least 1-year data analysis work experience including data management, transformation and visualization, or successful completion of Cerner’s Analytics Learning Lab
Preferred Qualifications
Background in healthcare, sciences, or information systems
Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL concepts
Experience with SAP Business Objects, Tableau, IBM Cognos or other report and visualization development tools
Basic CCL skills
Expectations
Must live in or around the Columbia, Missouri area

2-3 years of experience. Similar roles to a Data Analyst or Business Analyst. Position Overview The CX Analytics team is looking for a temporary Data Analyst to help with a project focusing on support Community analytics. The role will partner with our primary Community Business Analyst to analyze various customer experience measures and help us to develop a data model to weigh general health and success across several community forums. Project Scope Build a data model that weighs overall board health based on various measures and ranks them based on performance. Classify boards into a 3-Tier system based on performanceranking. Produce a reporting layer (dashboard) using a machine learning model that will run whenever data is refreshed to showcase up-to-date board healthrank. Enable Community Managers to incorporate this new ranking system into their general reporting process and provide them with geo-specific insights to improve performance in targeted locations. Responsibilities Navigate large sets of data and derive meaning to deliver insights to stakeholders Experience conducting market research, survey, focus groups, personal interviews and observation Translate business objectives into functional data requirements and balance them with technical feasibility, recommending changes in development, maintenance and platform standards as necessary Perform deep-dive analyses to understand trends, anomalies, and insights that will drive operational improvements Craft data stories through presentations, written summaries, and data visualizations that accurately outline problem statements and provide actionable and unbiased intelligence and recommendations Communicate findings from initiatives with clarity and accountability to the broader organizationstakeholders Document provenance of data, ETL logic, and code used to develop models The ideal candidate has strong oral and written communication skills with proven ability to deliver on commitments and persuasion skills to influence desired outcomes Minimum Qualifications Experience with BI development and database systems such as PowerBI, Looker and Tableau Experience with scripting languages such as R, Python or equivalent Proficiency using SQL to query large data sets Proficiency with Google Analytics andor Adobe Analytics Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, advanced modeling, creating chartsgraphs) and PowerPoint

Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors be more productive, informed, and connected. As a Data Analyst, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other analysts, engineers, and product managers in discovering data insights to help improve healthcare.

Our team brings a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds and we like to think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.

About Us
Here are some of the ways we bring value to doctors
Our data stack run on Python, Snowflake, Spark, and Airflow
Our web applications are built primarily using Ruby, Rails, JavaScript (Vue.js), and a bit of Golang
We have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our applications, forks of gems, our own internal gems, and open-source projects
We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently about 65% distributed
Find out more information on the Doximity engineering blog
Our company core values
Our recruiting process
Our product development cycle
Our on-boarding & mentorship process
Here's How You Will Make an Impact
Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts and other developers to define and complete data projects from data ingestion, to analysis to recommendations.
Show off your engineering skills by creating data products from scratch and automating code so they can be re-used continually.
Leverage Doximity's extensive datasets to identify and classify behavioral patterns of medical professionals on our platform.
Play a key role in creating both product and client-facing analytics.
Grow into a presentation/communication-focused role or dive deeper into more-involved technical challenges - the choice is yours.
About you
B.S. or M.S. in quantitative field with 2-4 years of experience.
Working knowledge of statistics and visualization.
Expert SQL skills with proven ability to create and to evaluate complex SQL statements involving numerous tables and complex relationships.
Fluent in Python and experience using common modules (numpy, pandas, statsmodels, matplotlib) for EDA.
Understanding of Object Oriented principles and testing as it relates to Data and Python.
Comfortable with UNIX command line interface and standard programming tools (vim/emacs, git, etc.)
Excellent problem solving skills and a strong attention to detail.
Ability to manage time well and prioritize incoming tasks from different stakeholders.
Fast learner; curiosity about and passion for data.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Amazon Web Services products (EC2, S3, Snowflake).
Prior exposure to workflow management tools (Airflow).
Prior exposure to machine learning techniques (regressors, classifiers, etc).
Experience leveraging Apache Spark to perform analyses or process data.
Benefits
Doximity has industry leading benefits. For an updated list, see our career page
More info on Doximity

We're thrilled to be named the Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area, and one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We're driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $3.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people's lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We're growing steadily, and there's plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact.

Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. Pet Plate is looking for an inquisitive, customer-obsessed Data Analyst to generate key business insights to assist in solving the diverse and complex challenges facing our business. This is an exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and help ensure everyone in the organization has the information they need to make better decisions for our customers and their pets. In this role, you will need to understand what data is being collected across the entire Pet Plate ecosystem, spearhead new data collection tasks, and help the rest of the organization understand the signal from the noise. The projects you’ll be working on will vary from understanding the lifetime value of our customers to analyzing customer emails from to unlock key insights to help inform our product strategy.

The ideal candidate is analytical, proactive, resourceful, and results-oriented. We are looking for a teammate who can interpret and communicate large amounts of data effectively, regardless of the stakeholder’s technical acumen. This is an opportunity to help build a pet food brand that people love and create an exceptional experience that they will want to tell their friends about.

This role reports into the Founder & Chief Product Officer and is located in New York, NY.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and maintain dashboards for Product, Marketing, and Operations teams to proactively identify areas of opportunity
Identify, map, and connect high-value data sources across the multiple tools and third-party platforms we use to run our business
Maintain datasets and work with the respective stakeholders to fill in gaps
Brainstorm how unstructured and disperse datasets can provide useful information to improve the customer experience
Assist in identifying and setting up BI tools
Conduct exploratory analyses to identify business opportunities or review the effectiveness of new business initiatives
Recommend and report on A/B tests, leveraging hypothesis testing methods
SKILLS
Excellent Excel and basic SQL/coding skills. Python and/or R is a plus.
Ability to work with large datasets and to be able to structure/manipulate unstructured datasets from a variety of sources
Strong command of basic statistics, mathematical models and e-commerce analysis
Experience using BI tools. Assist engineering in building out BI tools is a plus.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to work with all levels and collaborate with partners across organizations
Self-starter with a keen focus on performance
Exceptional multi-tasking ability
Detail-oriented, organized and accurate
Requirements
2+ years of full-time working experience in quantitative analysis roles
Knowledge of key metrics and business drivers for DTC subscription businesses
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, matched with the ability to tell a story with the data
Self-starter and independent problem-solver who escalates issues when appropriate
Ability to collaborate and communicate with engineering, UX, leadership, and non-technical disciplines
Exceptional attention to detail, while having the ability to see the bigger picture
Experience using agile methodologies to deliver products and technologies
An inquisitive mind. You are always looking for data and patterns that unearth critical information that will help the company be more effective at achieving its mission
A strong work ethic and a strong desire to build something that matters
A person with integrity, a sense of fairness and great team spirit
Ability to have fun and enjoy the camaraderie of collaborating with a team of individuals that are passionate about what they do to make the world a better place for dogs
Benefits
Competitive salary and benefits
Full medical, dental and vision coverage
Generous vacation policy and flexible PTO
Great location in the booming Hudson Yards
Free Pet Plate for you, and discounts for your friends & family
Onsite cafeteria and café serving breakfast, lunch and snacks
Fun team events and celebrations throughout the year
ABOUT PET PLATE

Pet Plate was founded in 2016 by Renaldo Webb when he realized that mainstream dog food was not good enough for his dog Winston and so he started cooking for him and soon discovered that there was a tremendous need for Pet Plate. The business has grown more than 800% since launching nationally in 2017, and Pet Plate is widely respected as a pioneer in the fresh-cooked pet food category, one of the fastest growing categories in the $35 billion pet food industry. What sets Pet Plate apart is its relentless pursuit of excellence in overall customer experience. We have built a small but nimble team dedicated to providing dogs everywhere with a fresh-cooked diet that is healthy, delicious, and ready to eat. The meals are custom-portioned to meet the individual caloric needs of each and every pup, and the meals are delivered right to the pet parent’s door for ease, convenience, and peace of mind.

Job Description:

GDIT is seeking a Data Manager - Bioinformatics Analyst in support of the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC) Infectious Disease Field Surveillance and Laboratory Research Services. As the Navy hub for the Armed Forces Health Surveillance Center the NHRC Operational Infectious Diseases Directorate conducts on-going, laboratory-based surveillance of US military populations in unique environments to quantify and study the etiology of infectious illnesses. This position will provide support services for operational infectious disease surveillance, accredited clinical laboratory testing, diagnostic evaluations, clinical research support and scientific research services.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Bioinformatics Analyst is responsible for providing collaborative bioinformatics support to the investigators at the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC). He/She is responsible for:
Support to NHRC’s COVID-19 surveillance efforts via the analysis of complex data sets.
Analysis and interpretation of high-throughput biomedical data generated by diverse platforms with emphasis on next-generation sequencing
Contribute to a team effort in designing, developing and deploying robust workflows, as well as custom scripts, to support the analysis of high-throughput data
Responsible for the organization and management of large genomic datasets, and the integration of data from multiple sources
Mining publicly available biological data to generate novel hypotheses or insights
Presenting analysis results, in a clear and concise manner, to an audience not familiar with bioinformatics
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelors Degree in biomedical science/bioinformatics/math/statistics/computer-related field
2 years related experience
Experience with bioinformatics tools and databases
Experience managing large genomic data sets including integration with data available from public sources
Proficiency in at least two of the following programming languages: Perl, Python, R, Java and C/C++
Record of scientific achievements including journal publications or presentations
Must be a US citizen with the ability to obtain a favorable NACLC T3 security investigation prior to start date.
Expected Competencies:
Experience in analysis of next generation sequencing (NGS) data (including quality metrics, mapping, variant calling, quantitation of gene expression and biological interpretation)
Experience in analysis of large genomic data sets including integration with data available from multiple sources
Hands-on experience in data processing and analyzing sequencing and expression and other array data including quality and biological assessment are also essential
Ability to understand and analyze data from complex experimental designs
Experience in at least two of the following areas: metagenomics, ChIPSeq, RNASeq, ExomeSeq, DHS-Seq, microarray analysis
Familiarity with public databases: NCBI, Ensembl, TCGA, cBioPortal, Broad FireHose

Job Description:

Parsons is a leader in the world of Engineering, Technical Services, Electronic Security Systems, and Cyber Security. We provide complex, solution-oriented services for the defense, intelligence, security, and space markets. Our purpose is to Deliver a Better World. We do this with digitally enabled defense, security, and infrastructure solutions. We have an immediate need for a Data Analyst / Test Engineer with the right multi-disciplinary experience to help us build our team and deliver timely results to our customers. Will you meet the challenge and help us?

Parsons is seeking a Data Analyst / Test Engineer to support on-going research and development (R&D) efforts at one of the Army's premier R&D Centers at Aberdeen Proving Ground (APG), Maryland. This position includes opportunities to influence Army next generation of radar and C5ISR systems and technologies.

Our Data Analyst with an engineering background support system performance tests and performance analysis of test data to validate system performance using data- statistical analysis tools created in MATLAB. Works with a team of experts to perform test data capture, support live fire performance testing, and perform data analysis from data collected during performance testing of Army radar systems. Maintains test data in a Database that is used for historical performance tracking. Develops new data analysis tools to improve performance analysis.

Qualifications:
BS in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar field
5+ years of experience in the test and evaluation systems and performance analysis using data analysis tools and statistical analysis tools
Experience using existing MATLAB analysis tools to generate performance reports, identify system anomalies, and determine the root cause for errors
Experience in the development of test plans, test procedures, schedules, and reports for laboratory and field tests/demonstrations
Experience developing, maintaining, and using data analytical tools
Experience programming with MATLAB, C/C++, SQL and/or Python
Experience performing data management and manipulation, algorithm development and optimizing analysis processes
Proven experience and skills in creating comprehensive test reports, white papers and presentations containing complex, statistical and data information
Knowledge of statistical formulas and techniques
Ability to analyze large amount of data for trends and anomalies
Understanding of radar architecture and radio frequency (RF) signal processing is a plus but not required
This position requires the selected candidate to hold an active Department of Defense Secret and eligible for a TS/SCI level security clearance, which requires US citizenship while working in support of a government contract.
Must be able to obtain, maintain and/or currently possess a security clearance.

Ready for action? We're looking for the kind of people who see this opportunity and don't hesitate to act. Parsons is a leader in the world of Technical Services and Engineering. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who have proven experience tackling some of the greatest challenges. Take your next step and apply today.

In addition to providing best in class solutions to our Fortune 150 clients and state agencies—since 2007, GoldenTech proudly serves our armed services by working with the US Air Force and US Navy.

Job Description:
Big Huge Games is looking for a Lead Data Analyst. In this position, you will be a key member of the product and analytics team, working with cross-functional leads in the studio, providing the game development teams the data and insights to help us achieve continued success and ensure that we offer the best possible experience to our players.

This a full-time (40hr/week) position onsite at our studio in Timonium, MD. No telecommuting or remote work options are available.
Due to the circumstances surrounding COVID19 positions may begin remote before transitioning to onsite.

Responsibilities
Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of our games' players.
Develop the framework, models, tools, and processes that will enable data-driven decisions in our live service games.
Provide recommendations based on game data to influence game economies, feature development, and product roadmaps.
Working with Product Management and Design, identify ways to improve the player experience and create enhanced revenue generation in the live service.
Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to studio management as necessary.
Motivate, support and coach other members of the data analytics team and help them meet their career growth goals.

Qualifications
Proven track record as an analyst, preferably within gaming, mobile, web, or online economy industries.
Advanced SQL skills, and comfort working in large data sets. R experience and familiarity with column store databases a plus.
High level of proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, or equivalent
Passion for problem-solving from generating insightful questions to research through presentation of results and follow on steps
Track record of success working in fast-paced environments with some shifting priorities.
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities both independently and with others.
Experience in defining highly complex requirements, with a focus on providing actionable and understandable results.
Excellent organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Prior management experience a plus.
BA/MSc in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field; Masters desirable.

Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.
The Healthcare Data Analyst functions as the lead analyst involved with the reporting of our network providers, products, members. The analyst will assist leadership in measuring provider network adequacy, perform analysis needed for various regulatory filings including CMS and NCQA. This role requires working with multiple sources of healthcare data (ex: provider, membership, and claims data) to meet both internal and external reporting requirements and support new initiatives. Projects range from simple programing and basic data manipulation/analysis to more advanced techniques.

Key Accountabilities:

· Analyst provides expertise in Geo Coding using/learning Quest Analytics software to provide assistance with provider network measurement for reporting and analysis.

· Help define internal system processes that produce accurate monthly reporting of provider data in support of contractual obligations and the maintenance of programs and processes used in day to day operations.

Job Description:
Make your mark

At Clorox, we build big brands that make everyday life better, every day. We value our differences, and challenge each other to think and act boldly. We try new things, succeed, fail and keep learning. We work hard, and have busy personal lives. And we’re all able to make a positive impact – at Clorox, in our communities, and in the lives of millions of people who invite us into their homes. Make your mark and help us drive Good Growth – growth that is profitable, sustainable and responsible.

Job Overview/Summary

The Global Data Analyst will play a key role in the development and implementation of
the global data governance program for the Clorox and ensure consistency, uniformity
and accuracy of master and reference data across the enterprise.
This role will be responsible for analyzing issues in the governance of enterprise
data, including problem definition, root cause analysis, and opportunity and
solution recommendations; participating in the development and implementation
of enterprise data governance principles, processes, standards and enterprise data governance systems;
communicating and coordinating with the Enterprise Data Organization in the
definition and prioritization of global data governance projects; and representing data
governance on company projects and initiatives to ensure data integrity.

Key Responsibilities

Key Job Duties

• Define and implement global processes, procedures, and best practices that
support the Clorox's data governance strategy and achieve strategic
project delivery
• Serves as a subject matter expert by leveraging industry best practices and
data governance mechanisms, processes, and procedures.
• Lead and manage domestic or global data governance workstreams in support of data governance enterprise projects.
• Responsible for analyzing issues in the governance of enterprise data,
including problem definition, root cause analysis.
• Lead issue resultion and recomendations accross geographies.
• Work with system owners and data stewards to document existing
change control processes and define new processes when needed
• Work with internal teams to develop and implement plans for assessing
the quality and integration of new data source
• Support the implementation of analytics for data governace processes.
• Manage the development of tools and techiques to support global data governance processes, including extraction, transformation and loading.

Key Skills, Abilities and Experience Required

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree from an accredited institution
3 years experience as business process analyst, data analyst or similar role.
3 years experience working on data quality, other enterprise data management initiatives.
3 years experience experience documenting business workflows, change management procedures, and data quality process
Employees must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position
Preferred Qualifications :
Bachelors degree from an accredited institution in Math, Physics, Engineering Business, IT or other related field
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a proven track record in
gathering and documenting comprehensive business requirements.
Strong team-oriented leadership skills; able to frame issues and
recommendations.
Strong interpersonal, facilitation, and communication skills (written and
oral).
Self-directed with a passion for data governance and data quality.
Very organized with high attention to detail.
Ability to interact with all levels of business as well as technical staff.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Must be customer service focused with internal and external clients.
Database and report generation experience preferred.
Data Science experience on Python/Pandas/NumPy
SAP experience strongly preferred.
Stibo STEP experience preferred.
Required Education

Bachelor’s Degree, College Diploma, or Equivalent (Required)

Digital Marketing & eCommerce Data Analyst

IT BEGAN WITH A FLIP-FLOP. But not just any flip-flop. A sandal that revolutionized the industry, bringing biomechanical support to a quintessential summer staple. From these humble beginnings in Australia to the bustling San Francisco Bay Area, Vionic has grown from a fledgling business to a global footwear brand. We’re bringing together style and science and reimagining the look of supportive footwear.

Vionic has been named a 2018 Gallup Great Workplace Award Winner, and is the only company recognized in the fashion and retail sector. Vionic is one of just 39 companies globally to receive the prestigious award, which celebrates companies that achieve exceptional performance by creating a culture of high-reaching employee engagement. Gallup has rated Vionic among the top 2% of all companies based on "Employee Engagement” exceeding the national average by 65 percentage points. We are also officially certified and recognized as a Marin/Bay Area/California Green Business.

In a Nutshell

The Digital Marketing & Ecommerce Analyst will provide strategic and analytic support for the eCommerce and Digital Marketing teams. The eCommerce Data Analyst will implement and maintain the eCommerce Dashboard and build best in class digital marketing analytics. They will passionate about diving into Google Analytics to find new learnings and opportunities that will optimize the website and digital marketing performance. The ideal candidate has a demonstrated drive for working with data to creatively and tenaciously solve complex problems.

What You’ll Do:
You’ll be the “go to” person for analysis and data for the Digital Marketing & Ecommerce team.
You will set up custom reporting, funnels and analyze Google Analytics data to drive insightful learnings and testing opportunities to improve conversion rates and revenue.
You will use your knack for communicating complex data analysis into easy to understand bullets to explain the “story” behind the numbers and share actionable recommendations
You will partner with marketing and operations managers to design promo testing with a close to evaluate incremental return and margin impacts.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and create custom reports to service the needs of business partners and leadership teams.
Create internal dashboards that automate key metrics and provide insights into performance within all aspects of eCommerce and digital marketing.
Manage voice of customer data to find new and better ways of collecting and communicating customer feedback.
Evaluate audience segmentation, creative and other marketing-related A/B tests and provide recommendations related to experiment prioritization.
Develop models that drive metrics and Ecommerce business toward improved operations and profitability – i.e. demand forecasting.
What You’ll Bring to the Team:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university in a relevant subject (Math, Finance, Economics, Digital/marketing Analytics or related field);
Minimum of 1-3 years of full-time work experience in a highly analytical capacity, preferably an eCommerce environment.
2-3 years’ experience Advanced Google Analytics, certification highly preferred.
Heavy experience with e-Commerce platforms such as Magento or similar highly preferred
Can communicate complex data analysis in easy to understand bullets.
Experience with digital media management such as AdWords, Facebook ads manager, Criteo, Pinterest, and the like.
Experience with product purchasing analysis and audience segmentation.
Self-starter with problem-solving skills.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, with particularly advanced Excel skills (vlookups and pivot tables, other advanced formulas are a must.)
Experience in the development of Ecom dashboards to weekly channel performance.
How We Take Care of our People:

We offer a fun and dynamic workplace with a robust benefits package. Once you become a regular, full-time employee you will have access to medical, dental, vision, 401K retirement plan with employer match, Long Term Disability, Life, and a generous amount of PTO. Fresh organic fruit and juices, wellness challenges, and celebrations abound, including Australia Day! You receive free shoes each season, and receive a seriously deep discount on our products because you will want more!

Our work spans markets and industries, from insurance and securities to private investments and new ventures.

Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.


Why Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts?

With almost 3 million members and roughly 50% of the market share, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts (BCBSMA) is a not for profit health insurance company in Massachusetts committed to making quality health care affordable. A career at BCBSMA offers many opportunities to make an impact on one of the biggest issues facing the U.S economy: health care cost. Growth opportunities, new challenging assignments, and coaching are available to help you on your career path.

Why the Business & Account Analytics Department?

The Business & Account Analytics team executes innovative analytics to inform corporate strategy in critical areas including competitiveness, affordability, profitability, provider payment reform and health care policy. As an Analyst on the Business & Account Analytics team, you will work with a rich dataset and a robust well-established Enterprise Data Warehouse to identify emerging drivers of health care trend and cost, market pressures, and profitability. In a constantly evolving health care system, you will have the opportunity to design compelling visualizations and build innovative models to influence and analyze new products, provider payment structures, and health care delivery mechanisms that will lower cost and improve the quality of care provided to our members.

What are we looking for in an applicant?

The ideal candidate has a background in a quantitative field. Experience in working with large data sets and data driven decision-making is required. Experience in a healthcare setting (e.g., hospital, payer) is preferred. Also essential is close attention to detail, focus on results, and the ability to effectively present results. The candidate in this position is required to constantly innovate, challenge assumptions, and generate new ideas and process improvements. Finally, we are seeking a team player with the ability to collaborate with others towards shared goals.

Required Technical and Behavior Competencies
Use of software for data analysis, extraction, and manipulation (e.g., Python, R, SAS, SQL), data visualization (e.g., Tableau) and analytic automation (e.g. scripting, macros).
Time management skills to execute on a variety of projects under specific time restraints
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of business partners, including clinical and technical staff
Strong written and oral communication skills in a variety of settings
Creative problem solving skills
Exceptional analytical skills and technical expertise
The ability to manage priorities
Strong customer focus
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree required with a focus in Math, Business, Healthcare or related field strongly preferred
A minimum of 3 years of experience preferably in healthcare or related industry

Job Description:
About RevolutionParts:
RevolutionParts is a rapidly-growing software company based in sunny Arizona. We are a tech company dedicated to modernizing the auto industry with a revolutionary parts commerce platform that’s already helped over a thousand dealerships sell auto parts online.

We’re seeking talented individuals who can adapt to a fast-paced environment. Join our team to work with a down-to-earth group of people who stick to our core values and genuinely care about providing a quality experience to customers and employees alike!

About the role:
RevolutionParts is looking for an experienced Business Data Analyst who will work closely with our teams to provide actionable insights and recommendations to various business units. This may include working with the product and marketing teams to analyze our customer experience, look at behaviors and come up with ways to improve ecommerce conversion rates, collaborate on marketing campaigns, business forecasting, budgeting, and do cohort analysis to analyze customer retention.

Unfortunately, we are NOT able to sponsor work VISAs.

What You'll Do Here:
You will uncover different challenges concerning customers and product issues through data analysis and partnering with leaders
You will work with a large volume and variability of data to understand meaningful trends and important outliers signaling change
You are going to develop intuitive dashboards to drive key measures and Customer Success through trending and segmentation
You translate insight from the data into actionable stories for other partners within the business
You will visualize data through tools like Tableau and other dashboards
Use SQL to pull data out of our data warehouse

More About You
You are a proven data analyst who is strong in SQL, Excel and statistical tools to interpret data (e.g. R, Pandas or Python modules)
2-5 years experience in quantitative analyst role
You possess a solid understanding of statistics and understand data significance
You are great in visualizing data in Tableau
You understand the fundamentals of data models and performing ETL (e.g., through Python)
You have excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills, and great attention to detail and data integrity
You have unwavering curiosity and desire to share meaningful insights to improve the customer experience
It is also great if you have a degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, or computer science.


Benefits:
Top salary
Medical, dental, and 401k retirement plan
Rewards for high-performers (opportunity for bonuses!)
Opportunity for career advancement
Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking
Casual dress code
Free food! Catered lunch every Friday + fully stocked fridge and snacks
Drinks on us with team happy hours and beer fridge
Gym reimbursement

General Position Summary:

Under general direction, the Data Analyst provides on-going support of business performance reporting initiatives to assess quality, service and performance. This position requires solid analytic and problem solving skills to support the team with healthcare data analytics and reporting initiatives, and able to identify deficiencies or opportunities for improvement.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities:

+ Researches, collects, compiles and analyzes data sources for reporting purposes.

+ Prepares and loads data files into SQL database tables.

+ Works directly with team members to assist with reporting initiatives.

+ Assists with producing ad-hoc data pulls and reports.

+ Conducts quality assurance of data marts and reports.

+ Conducts data profiling of data sources.

+ Develops and maintains documentation on reporting standards, dictionary of field descriptions, reporting criteria and guidelines.

+ Works with business end-users individually to improve their ability to utilize reporting capabilities, determine problems and develop appropriate solutions.

+ Supports performance improvement duties for the team.

+ Works with the project team (both technical and business) to ensure requirements are accurate, clear and understood by those participating in the project.

Secondary Functions:

Job Scope:

+ Job consists of unique and multi-dimensional work situations with routine variations from the norm. Job involves a moderate to high degree of complexity. Duties are performed independently under general supervision and work is verified by results. Decisions are made within established departmental guidelines, but also by using judgment for the best reasonable outcome. Errors in judgment or work performance could result in insufficient operation for the department.

+ Supervisory Responsibility:

NA

Specific Job Skills and Experience:

+ Proficient in Microsoft Excel, with the ability to create Excel Pivot tables and formulas to summarize several spreadsheets of data.

+ 2+ years of Data Analyst experience.

+ 2+ years of working knowledge of extracting and manipulating data from multiple data sources using SQL.

+ Intermediate SQL skills and good understanding of querying relational databases.

+ Experience documenting detailed requirements, design documents, and workflows in support of BI or sophisticated reporting capabilities.

+ Demonstrate excellent organizational, analytical, writing, problem solving and interpersonal skills.

+ Demonstrate the drive and initiative to learn new Business Intelligence technologies.

+ Healthcare industry experience is a plus.

+ Experience with Microsoft Reporting Services (SSRS) or similar Business Intelligence tools is a plus.

Education:

+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management or similar from an accredited college or university required.

+ Combination of relevant education, certifications and experience may substitute for a completed degree.

Job Conditions:

+ Job requires hours that may exceed 8 hours per day and/or 40 hours per week during times of peak activity. Moderate to high job pressure exists in the balancing of several projects with conflicting and sometimes changing deadlines.

+ Less than 5% travel required

Arlington, VA - Kaimetrix, L.L.C. is seeking a professional Data Analyst to support our Federal Government customer, Defense Travel Management Office (DTMO). The primary place of performance is Arlington, VA, with occasional client meetings in Alexandria, VA. The position will start out completely remote, but the team is typically onsite for approximately 1.5 to 2 days per week.

The Data Analyst is responsible for a wide range of tasks, from creating data sets, reports, providing data for use by DTMO Business Intelligence tool (Tableau), assisting in data integration, data quality and dashboard development to support performance management.

The following tasks are required:
Document the organization’s current business process flows
Identify and document functional requirements for information systems
Develop project documentation and user training materials according to program specifications
Produce database development/data extraction using Structured Query Language (SQL) skills to create reporting queries and perform analysis on the database
Assist in data integration using standard techniques
Ensure all products delivered demonstrate expert level technical writing skills, both to document reporting/design requirements and communicate effectively with customers and vendors (e.g. data dictionaries)
Analyze and implement data quality improvements (e.g. using DataFlux)
Recommend best practices in commercial operational and financial travel data
Apply project management skills to oversee implementation of new data sources and oversee minor projects (systemic data correction, table modification and data population)
Support the implementation, expansion and maintenance of a performance management framework aligned to the DTMO strategic plan that cascades, manages, and tracks DoD Travel Enterprise performance.
Provide expert understanding of the principles and methods for evaluating program or organizational performance using financial and nonfinancial measures to include identification of evaluation factors, metrics, and outcomes.
Support the development, implementation and maintenance of strategic and operational performance metrics to assist the government in measuring the effectiveness and efficiency of the DoD Travel Enterprise including key performance indicators (KPIs), performance reports, and dashboards for managers, executive leadership, and other stakeholders to track program performance and assess the overall health of the DoD Travel Enterprise.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in a related field
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
Strong experience with SQL to include writing queries
Minimum 1 year experience with DataFlux preferred
Minimum of an active Secret clearance is required

Job Description:
Big Huge Games is looking for a Lead Data Analyst. In this position, you will be a key member of the product and analytics team, working with cross-functional leads in the studio, providing the game development teams the data and insights to help us achieve continued success and ensure that we offer the best possible experience to our players.

This a full-time (40hr/week) position onsite at our studio in Timonium, MD. No telecommuting or remote work options are available.
Due to the circumstances surrounding COVID19 positions may begin remote before transitioning to onsite.

Responsibilities
Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of our games' players.
Develop the framework, models, tools, and processes that will enable data-driven decisions in our live service games.
Provide recommendations based on game data to influence game economies, feature development, and product roadmaps.
Working with Product Management and Design, identify ways to improve the player experience and create enhanced revenue generation in the live service.
Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to studio management as necessary.
Motivate, support and coach other members of the data analytics team and help them meet their career growth goals.

Qualifications
Proven track record as an analyst, preferably within gaming, mobile, web, or online economy industries.
Advanced SQL skills, and comfort working in large data sets. R experience and familiarity with column store databases a plus.
High level of proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, or equivalent
Passion for problem-solving from generating insightful questions to research through presentation of results and follow on steps
Track record of success working in fast-paced environments with some shifting priorities.
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities both independently and with others.
Experience in defining highly complex requirements, with a focus on providing actionable and understandable results.
Excellent organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Prior management experience a plus.
BA/MSc in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field; Masters desirable.

SUMMARY OF POSITION FUNCTION:

The Data Analyst position is responsible for working closely with the Managing Director of IT and Data in identifying relevant sources of data and assisting with the collection, analyzing, and the development of interactive dashboards and reports that will be used to prove recommendations for improving the operations and outcomes as well as meeting internal and external reporting requirements. The Data Analyst works closely with the departmental leads, including program, quality, and finance leadership, to develop and maintain the data infrastructure. This person reports to the Managing Director of IT and Data.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work closely with partner leads to assist in developing strategic data and information management to assist in reaching established outcomes and measures
Identify, collect, and analyze data, specifically as it relates to the agreed-upon data points.
Assist in identifying trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of data sets
Assist with evaluating internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization
Work directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships
Work with stakeholders to develop and maintain workflow within systems such as SharePoint and Libraries.

· Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization

· Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations

· Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools

· Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques

· Familiar with EMR and EHR data platforms and a practical understanding of data

· Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, JavaScript, SQL, and ETL

· Practical experience in dashboard development through the use of technology tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and

· Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience to meet the needs of the position.

EXPERIENCE:

· 3+ years of experience mining data as a Data Analyst or Data Specialist

· 3+ years of experience with working with dashboards and analytical tools in an enterprise environment

Must possess a valid Driver’s License with a satisfactory driving record

Infotree is a Global company providing Workforce Solutions to clients through its network of offices in over 25 countries.

• This is a temp to hire opportunity based on candidate performance and attendance.
• Utilizing the data and develop the approach/finished product to enable business owners to make informed decisions.

• Healthcare experience a plus.

Description
Data Analyst to work through data requests for Life Sciences company .. Work in Morris County NJ area, NYC or Irvine, CA

Interpret data & analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

By gathering, analyzing and cleansing information, will create business reports for teams and individuals across the manufacturing unit.

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Designing and maintaining data systems and databases; this includes fixing coding errors and other data-related problems.

Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Qualifications
BA or BS in statistics, math, computer science, physics or other technical related field; Master"s degree is preferred.
Minimum of 2 years working experience in technical data analysis, data science, or data warehousing with proven business analysis experience.

Data Analyst

About Juntos

Financial institutions around the world use the Juntos Conversational Account Management (CAM) platform to proactively engage their customers at scale. Juntos combines advanced technology with human intelligence to create engaging, one-to-one, long-term conversations with consumers in high-impact digital channels like SMS and WhatsApp. Banks across four continents have used Juntos to power Conversational Account Management with millions of customers in 26 languages, driving increased uptake and retention of financial products.

About the role

As a Data Analyst, you feed our process of discovery and learning as you synthesize powerful insights from conversations with millions around the globe. You will work closely with content designers to harness these insights to optimize Juntos conversations by identifying and refining hypotheses through A/B testing. You will also work closely with account managers to communicate customer success stories and pain points to the banks that use Juntos.

In this role, you will not only dig into data, but also sharpen and extend our codebase of custom analytic tools. As the owner of these tools, you can shape how Juntos extracts and shares data-driven insights both internally and externally. You will be encouraged to identify opportunities to improve processes and take on projects to grow Juntos’ analytic capabilities.

About you

If you are a good fit, you'll likely have many of the traits below, and/or be eager to develop them:
You have 3+ years of experience in data analysis and/or social science.
You have experience in Python. You’ve used tools like PySpark, Pandas, Matplotlib, and Jupyter.
You’ve been responsible for end-to-end data analysis.
You’ve collaborated with others to understand their questions and identify which can (and which can’t) be answered using data.
You’ve wrangled unfamiliar input data and made decisions about how to transform it to facilitate analysis.
You’ve conducted analyses and communicated your learnings through written reports and visualizations to others who are less familiar with data and statistics.
You have experience with Git and take pride in maintaining well-documented repositories.
You appreciate being part of a multidisciplinary team and have a desire to both teach and learn.
You demonstrate humility in actions, conversations, and mentality. You receive strong personal satisfaction from collective success.
Current US work authorization is required. We accept transfers of H-1B visas.

Juntos is venture-backed by Aligned Partners and Omidyar Network and headquartered in San Carlos, California. To apply, please send a resume and cover letter to join.the.team [at] juntosglobal.com

The Data Analyst will gather, organize, interpret and present data to support the Commercial team for Ciner Resources and overall business strategy. In addition, this role will create metrics and reporting, root cause analysis and provide summaries of analytical modeling.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
